column5: Aug 14 Activist investor Nelson Peltz's hedge fund  Trian Partners  has picked up a more than 7 percent stake in Sysco Corp for about $1.6 billion  calling the largest U.S. food distributor's shares "undervalued".

column4: Nelson Peltz's Trian Partners picks 7 pct stake in Sysco
column5: Aug 14 Activist investor Nelson Peltz's hedge fund  Trian Partners  has picked up a more than 7 percent stake in Sysco Corp  calling the largest U.S. food distributor's shares undervalued.

column4: Target Corp merchandising executive Jose Barra to leave
column5: Retailer Target Corp said its vice president in charge of household supplies  electronics and sporting goods was leaving as the company narrows its focus to products such as apparel  wellness products and children's items.

column4: Target Corp merchandising executive Jose Barra to leave
column5: Aug 14 Retailer Target Corp said its vice president in charge of household supplies  electronics and sporting goods was leaving as the company narrows its focus to products such as apparel  wellness products and children's items.

column4: Global automakers scramble to assess damage from huge blasts at China port
column5: BEIJING/TOKYO Global automakers including Volkswagen AG  and Toyota Motor Corp  scrambled on Friday to assess damage to cars and facilities after two massive explosions in the port city of Tianjin  China's largest auto import hub.

column4: UPDATE 2-Global automakers scramble to assess damage from huge blasts at China port
column5: * Tianjin is China's largest auto import hub   (Recasts  adds details from automakers)

column4: REFILE-Japan car makers  retailers report minor damage from blasts at China port
column5: TOKYO/BEIJING  Aug 14 Several Japanese automakers including Toyota Motor Corp reported damage to cars and facilities after two huge explosions at the Chinese port of Tianjin tore through an industrial area where toxic chemicals and gas were stored.

column4: UPDATE 2-Tyson cuts beef production due to cattle shortage
column5: Aug 14 Tyson Foods Inc on Friday said it is permanently ceasing beef production at its plant in Denison  Iowa  effective immediately  as cattle ranchers work to rebuild shrunken herds following the severe Midwestern drought.

column4: Tyson to cut beef production due to cattle shortage
column5: Aug 14 Tyson Foods Inc said it will cut beef production capacity due to a shortage of cattle and will close beef operations at its plant in Denison  Iowa  effective Friday.

column4: France's Geodis nears $800 mln deal for OHL -sources
column5: Aug 14 French shipping and transit company Geodis SA is near a deal to pay close to $800 million for U.S. contract shipping provider Ozburn-Hessey Logistics  LLC in what would be the latest in a string of logistics tie-ups this year  people familiar with the deal said.

column4: UPDATE 2-Vale halts Amazon nickel mine output after court order
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Aug 14 Vale SA stopped operations at its Onça Puma nickel mine in Brazil's Amazon after a Brazilian federal court on Friday ordered the halt because of disputed payments to indigenous communities.

column4: Hedge funds pulled back ahead of Chinese turmoil
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 14 A group of prominent private investors appears to have avoided some of the pain caused by recent market turmoil in China.

column4: UPDATE 1-What to Watch in the Week Ahead and on Monday  Aug. 17
column5: (Removes entry on economist Bill Witherell's LIVECHAT as the event got cancelled.)       WEEK AHEAD      The stragglers for the earnings season - Home Depot  Wal-Mart and a few others - will report results to close out the quarter next week  with expectations that retailers would see decent sales after recent revisions show better-than-expected activity in the second quarter. The markets will also continue to watch the Chinese yuan after its unexpected devaluation this week  with anticipation

column4: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway hints at new purchase  ups Charter stake
column5: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc  on Friday said it boosted its stake in cable TV operator Charter Communications Corp  and signaled it may have another large investment planned after agreeing to buy Precision Castparts Corp in its largest-ever purchase.

column4: UPDATE 2-Top U.S. hedge funds stayed bullish in Q2 on energy as slump began
column5: NEW YORK  Aug 14 Top U.S. hedge funds made bullish bets on the energy sector in the second quarter even as companies' shares began a slide toward multi-year lows on concerns about oversupply  regulatory filings showed on Friday.

column4: Exclusive: Spectra bidding for the entirety of Williams Cos - sources
column5: Spectra Energy Corp   an oil and natural gas pipeline company  is bidding for the whole of Williams Companies Inc   even though its market capitalization is about half that of Williams  people familiar with the matter said.
